alert.note: Alert for Park (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 10:28AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Colorado, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Agate Creek, Little Agate Creek, Badger Creek, Herring Creek, Buffalo Gulch, South Fork South Platte River and South Platte River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Park County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
